title: 2022 Ford GT Alan Mann Heritage Edition
description: This 2022 Ford GT is one of 30 Alan Mann Heritage Edition examples built in commemoration of the lightweight 1966 Ford GT experimental race cars constructed by Alan Mann Racing. The car was ordered by the seller through Pat Milliken Ford in Redford, Michigan, and now has 13 miles. Finished in Alan Mann Red over Ebony Alcantara upholstery, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Factory-specified equipment includes the Gloss Exterior Carbon-Fiber Package, 20" exposed carbon-fiber wheels, six-point harness anchors, and red brushed paddle shifters in addition to an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, butterfly doors, Sparco seats, and a touchscreen infotainment system. This Ford GT was listed on BaT in October 2024 and is now offered again with a window sticker, manufacturer's literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller's LLC.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2022 Ford GT Alan Mann Heritage Edition at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #173,314.

First unveiled at the 2015 North American International Auto Show, the Chris Svensson–designed second-generation GT was built by Multimatic of Markham, Ontario, with production beginning in December 2016. The car features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Ebony Alcantara trim with gold and red accent stitching was specified with the Alan Mann Heritage Edition along with exposed carbon fiber door panel inserts wearing #16 roundels. The fixed-position Sparco seats incorporate manually reclining carbon-fiber shells, and the driver’s seat is paired with an adjustable steering column and pedal box. Six-point harness anchors were optioned from the factory, and additional equipment includes a touchscreen infotainment system, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The underside features front and rear carbon-fiber aero panels. The window sticker lists initial delivery through Pat Milliken Ford in Redford, Michigan, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total MSRP of $769,500.
